FAQ.title: Jackson Electronics Products
FAQ.subtitle: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.question: How do I scan slides?
FAQ.answer: "You can scan slides using the JE Transparency Adapter (part number STA8901) available from Jackson Electronics."
FAQ.question: Where can I find the latest drivers for my ScanMaster?
FAQ.answer: "You can download the latest software drivers from the Jackson Electronics Web page."
FAQ.question: What is the largest sheet that I can scan?
How do I fax with my ScanMaster?
FAQ.answer: "You can turn your scanner into a fax machine by purchasing the FaxRight add-on component (part number STA4500) available from Jackson Electronics."
FAQ.question: What is the difference between optimal and digital zoom?
FAQ.answer: "With optical zoom the Digicam's lense phyiscal moves inside the camera; with digital zoom, the camera's 'electronic brain' zooms the image. If you zoom too much, your image will become pixelated."
FAQ.question: What sort of batteries should I use with the DigiCam?
FAQ.answer: "Nickel Metal Hydride (NiMH) batteries work the best and having the longest lifetime. Nickel-Cadium batteries also work very well as do Alkaline batteries. Do not use Lithium batteries."
FAQ.question: What resolution should I use for 4x6 in. photos?
FAQ.answer: "We recommend 640x480 for 4x6 images, 1024x768 for 5x7 in. photos, and 1600x1200 for 8x10 in photos."
FAQ.question: Can the DigiCam be harmed by airport X-ray machines?
FAQ.answer: "No, there is no evidence that X-ray machines can affect the performance or quality of DigiCam photos."
